Module org.example._50zo
Package Model.Cards

Class CardPile

java.lang.Object
Model.Cards.CardPile
public class CardPile extends Object
Represents a pile of cards with an accumulated value in the game. This class manages a queue-based card pile and calculates the total value by summing all card values. It implements special game rules, including automatic value adjustments for Aces when the pile exceeds certain thresholds. The pile maintains cards in FIFO (First-In-First-Out) order and provides methods to add cards, retrieve the top card, and access cards below the top. Special rule: When a card with value 10 (typically an Ace) is added and causes the pile to exceed 50 points, the pile value is reduced by 9, effectively treating the Ace as having a value of 1 instead of 10.
Since:
2025

  • Constructor Details

    • CardPile

      public CardPile(Deck deck)
      Constructs a new CardPile initialized with one card drawn from the specified deck. The initial pile value is set to the value of this first card.
      Parameters:
      deck - the deck from which to draw the initial card for the pile

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(Card card)
      Adds a card to the pile and updates the total value accordingly. The card is added to the rear of the queue, making it the new top card. Special adjustment: If the added card has a value of 10 and adding it causes the pile value to exceed 50, the pile value is reduced by 9. This effectively treats the card as having a value of 1, simulating the flexible value behavior of an Ace in many card games.
      Parameters:
      card - the card to add to the pile

    • getBackCards

      public List<Card> getBackCards()
      Returns a list of all cards beneath the top card in the pile. This method removes all cards except the top one from the pile and returns them in the order they were added. This is useful for transferring cards to a discard pile or recharge deck. Important: This method modifies the pile by removing cards. After calling this method, only the top card remains in the pile. If the pile has only one card or is empty, an empty list is returned and the pile remains unchanged.
      Returns:
      a list containing all cards below the top card in the order they were added, or an empty list if pile size is 1 or less

    • getTopCard

      public Card getTopCard()
      Returns the top card of the pile (most recently played card) without removing it. The top card is the last card that was added to the pile and represents the current state of play.
      Returns:
      the card at the top of the pile, or null if the pile is empty

    • getValuePile

      public int getValuePile()
      Returns the accumulated value of all cards in the pile. This value reflects the sum of all card values, including any special adjustments that have been applied (such as Ace value changes).
      Returns:
      the total value of the card pile
